data.text: @tripperhead The problem with following positive cases as the metric is unreliable, too many people with little or no symptoms, not reporting or not even getting tested. Hospitalization numbers are more accurate.
@tripperhead Is there data about deaths on vaccine type groups?

@tripperhead I think Hospitalizations is the most critical metric. We know this variant is more contagious and less lethal than delta. So when the hospitals are not overwhelmed people will get better care and the number of infected will have already started to decrease.
@tripperhead It’s amazing. Almost 1 million over the age of 70 that aren’t properly vaccinated (2 doses) and 2 million over the age of 60.  I know we all know but still. It’s incredible
Breakdown of deaths, hospitalisations and ICU cases by age, as of March 7th. https://t.co/DVv6fAKR4T
